channel.title: Analysis 🔬 on Analyst
channel.description: Recent content in Analysis 🔬 on Analyst

item.title: Forensic Analysis Overview 🗒
item.description: Intro Main idea is to concentrate on some areas, answer some specific questions, like: Is there child exploitation material?

item.title: Network Triage 🛰️
item.description: Intro Ports idetify services (usually, but not always). System ports are forensically important 0-1023. User ports 1024-49151 Private 49152-last Cheatsheets for known ports here.

item.title: Mail Forensics 📬
item.description: Tools 🛠 libpff - to parse and extract PAB, PST and OST Mailboxes (download). Example: pffexport -q -f all -m all outlook.

item.title: Persistence ⛳
item.description: To stay persistent, it’s neccesary to stay quite, at least for some time. Rootkits Registry

item.title: System Supernova 💫
item.description: One of the main things to know when performing forensic analysis is knowing what’s normal and what’s not. It would take ages to google every single pinch of this information, that’s why I have decided to make a clean install of several systems and capture their state to have an idea what’s good for each of them.

item.title: Timelines ⏱️
item.description: If something was downloaded and the accessed in several days - then the suspect knew about this file.

item.title: Windows Forensic Analysis 🗒️
item.description: WMI Attacks Detection Here is an overview of powershell and WMI. Reference [1] SANS poster on Windows Forensics

item.title: Mobile Forensic Analysis 🗒️
item.description: Tool leveling pyramid The methods are placed in the order from the easiest to the hardest and most time-consuming:

item.title: Cloud Basics 📚
item.description: Virtualization vs Cloud Cloud computing is the on-demand availability of resources. PROS CONS flexibility, agility and choices Security?
